data.title: Firefighter tee shirts!
data.text: Great place to shop for unique firefighter and police t-shirts. The firefighter on duty was full of great stories!  Neat place. Misinformation on the hours - they are open past Labor Day from noon to 8 wed to sat.

data.title: Fire t shirts
data.text:
lots of cool VA Beach shirts that were totally different from everyone elses.
stop in and check it out, will be a museum someday

data.title: Summer Season Hours
data.text: I found the VB Firefighters store to be open everyday noon to 8pm from Memorial Day until Labor Day.  It's a summer tourist attraction!

data.title: Not what we thought it would be....
data.text: We experienced frustration with the hours of operation also-they were closed when we arrived on a Friday, only open 12-8 Sat/Sun.  We returned on Saturday and found a great selection of Tshirts and good conversation with the store owner or manager (?), but my husband (retired firefighter) was hoping they would have more to look at than just Tshirts, lol.  Still glad we stopped, but went on to the police/fire/rescue museum in Norfolk to get his "fix" for memorabilia, lol.

data.title: Nice shop
data.text: This is a neat piece of history. As a former firefighter, it is great to see an original firehouse. They don't have much in the way of museum pieces, but as time goes on it will grow. What was cool was all the fire house shirts from Virginia Beach in one spot. I picked up a couple of shirts for myself and my son. You don't need to spend a long time here, just stop by, learn some history and get a shirt.

data.title: Great place to shop
data.text: The firefighters of Virginia beach have purchased the original first fire station of Virginia as its meeting hall and the front portion of the place is a great place to purchase tshirts from each of the fire stations of Virginia beach along with lots of other FD items.

data.title: Awesome attraction
data.text: While exploring the "tourist attractions" around the oceanfront in Virginia Beach, we came across this new store.  How cool to have "Virginia Beach's First Firehouse" now owned by the city's professional firefighters!  They have lots of t-shirts and it looks like their inventory is growing by the day.  While we were there we ran into the union president who gave us a short tour with some history thrown in.  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Based solely on store hours of operation
data.text:
We attempted to visit this store on our last day in Virginia Beach.  We parked in the ramp by Neptune's Park and walked 8 or so blocks to the store.  We weren't concerned about our far away park job, we were enjoying the other shops along the way.  

Once we arrived at the store we were absolutely CRUSHED!  

They are CLOSED Mondays & Tuesdays (We went on a Tuesday).  REALLY??? This store is located in the heart of Virginia Beach tourism!  And being the end of July, the peak of vacation season on top of it!

Being from the Midwest, with our strong ties to our local fire dept... And after driving 1200 miles, I knew we would be well stocked with merchandise before we had left.

We really looked forward to visiting this store.  What a bummer. 
 
I understand overhead can be high, and this store is quite "Niche", hence to odd hours...
But hopefully, this will help someone else who plans to visit this shop: To not attempt to go on those days.

data.title: One of a kind shop in Virginia Beach!
data.text: Great shop to pick up a shirt from some brother firefighters while on vacation. The store has some grear history, and the staff has some great stories to share. Supported their great cause by buying a couple cool shirts.

data.title: Virginia Beach Fire Store & 1st Station
data.text: It was a cool place as we talked with real firefighters and purchased some local fire shirts.  It is at the corner of 24th Street and Pacific Ave right near concert stages and other history attractions including the Old Coast Guard Station.  It is right in the middle of everything including the beach and sea shore.  Loved it!

data.title: Pursuit
data.text: This is a great store with ALOT of Virginia Beach history and really cool items to look at and buy.  Many, many hours of hard work turned this historic landmark into a neat shop for anyone visiting the area to see.  There is even a television that constantly shows pictures of actual fire scenes taken in the area. I would definitely recommend this firefighters store as a place to stop, browse and shop!!

data.title: A Must See Shop!
data.text: Store is site of first fire station at  Virginia Beach. Owned and run by firefighters. Nice collection of tshirts, cups and water bottles. Merchandise selection will be expanded in upcoming weeks. Retired fighter and his 12 year old nephew were there the day of our visit. Told us history of the building. My husband being a retired firefighter really enjoyed the store and looks forward to upcoming visits.

data.title: Very Cool T-shirts & see a piece of VA Beach history
data.text:
We came across a cool little store that used to be the first fire station in Virginia Beach from back in the 1920's. They had lots of unique souvenirs, mainly T-shirts from the different fire stations of the city. My understanding is that the store/old fire station is collectively owned by all of the city firefighters.

We purchased 3 shirts while talking with the clerk who was actually a retired Virginia Beach firefighter. After shopping we took a short tour through the old firehouse.
